alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 7:34PM CST until February 17 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hoover, Alabaster, Pelham, Helena, Leeds, Moody, Calera, Chelsea, Montevallo, Columbiana, Wilsonville, Indian Springs Village, Vincent, Harpersville, Westover, Wilton, Oak Mountain State Park, Highland Lakes, Oak Mountain Amphitheater and Meadowbrook.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
